name: insurable
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
If someone or something is insurable, it is possible to buy insurance (= an agreement in which you pay a company money and they pay your costs if you have an accident, injury, etc.) for them or it: Her health had deteriorated so much that she was no longer insurable. The crop is not insurable in such a rainy part of the country.
More examplesFewer examplesEven people who have had cancer can still be insurable.The postcode is the most important factor in determining whether a property is insurable or not. Some risks are not insurable at any price.One of the advantages of a small car like this is that it is realistically insurable for younger drivers.
